quest_title: For a given thermocouple, the thermo e.m.f. can be
explanation_txt:
Thermo emf can be positive, negative and zero based on the following conditions:

  • When the temperature of hot junction is equal to the temperature of cold junction \(T_{c}\) or \(2T_{n}-T_{c}\), thermo emf is \(0\) where \(T_{n}\) is the neutral temperature at which thermo emf is maximum.
  • When the temperature of hot junction is in between \(T_{c}\) and \(2T_{n}-T_{c}\), thermo emf is +ve.
  • When the temperature of hot junction is greater than \(2T_{n}-T_{c}\), thermo emf is -ve.
question_plain_title: For a given thermocouple, the thermo e.m.f. can be
explanation_plain_text:
Thermo emf can be positive, negative and zero based on the following conditions:

  • When the temperature of hot junction is equal to the temperature of cold junction or , thermo emf is where is the neutral temperature at which thermo emf is maximum.
  • When the temperature of hot junction is in between and , thermo emf is +ve.
  • When the temperature of hot junction is greater than , thermo emf is -ve.

quest_title: The number of hydrogen ions in 1.0 ml solution of pH 13 is
explanation_txt:
\(pH=13 \\ \Rightarrow [H^+] = 10^{-13} M\)

So,

\(M = 10^{-13} \\ V = 0.001 \\ \Rightarrow n = MV = 10^{-16} \\ \begin{align} \Rightarrow \text{no. of ions} & = n \times N_A \\ & = 10^{-16} \times 6.022 \times 10^{23}  \\ & = 6.022 \times 10^7\end{align}\)

quest_title: If the position vectors of three points \(A,B\) and \(C\) are respectively \(i + j + k\) , \(2i + 3j - 4k\) and \(7i + 4j + 9k\), then the unit vector to the plane containing the triangle \(ABC\) is
explanation_txt:
Unit vector perpendicular to plane of \(\Delta ABC\) is,

\(\cfrac{\overrightarrow{AB} \times \overrightarrow{AC} }{|\overrightarrow{AB} \times \overrightarrow{AC} |} \),

where \(\overrightarrow{AB} ={\bf i}+2{\bf j}-5{\bf k}\) and \(\overrightarrow{AC} =6{\bf i}+3{\bf j}+8{\bf k}\)

\(\overrightarrow{AB} \times \overrightarrow{AC} =31{\bf i}-38{\bf j}-9{\bf k}\) and \(|\overrightarrow{AB} \times \overrightarrow{AC} |\, =\sqrt{2486} \)

Required vector = \(\cfrac{31{\bf i}-38{\bf j}-9{\bf k}}{\sqrt{2486} } \).

quest_title: When a spring is stretched by 2 cm, it stores 100 J of energy. If it is stretched further by 2 cm, the stored energy will be increased by
explanation_txt:
\(100 = \cfrac { 1 } { 2 } k x ^ { 2 } \quad\) (given )
\(W = \cfrac { 1 } { 2 } k \left( x _ { 2 } ^ { 2 } - x _ { 1 } ^ { 2 } \right) = \cfrac { 1 } { 2 } k \left[ ( 2 x ) ^ { 2 } - x ^ { 2 } \right]\)
\(= 3 \times \left( \cfrac { 1 } { 2 } k x ^ { 2 } \right) = 3 \times 100 = 300 \mathrm { J }\)

explanation_plain_text: (given )

explanation_txt: \(\begin{aligned} H &=\cfrac{(u \cos \theta)^{2}}{2 g} \\ \therefore & u \cos \theta=\sqrt{2 g H} \\ T &=\cfrac{2 u \cos \theta}{g}=\cfrac{2}{g} \sqrt{2 g H} \\ &=\sqrt{\cfrac{8 g H}{g^{2}}}=\sqrt{\cfrac{8 H}{g}} \end{aligned}\)

quest_title: A concave mirror forms image on a screen of twice the linear dimensions of object. The object and screen are moved until the size of image become 3 times. The shift of screen is 20cm then shift of object will be
explanation_txt:
\(\quad\)m = v/u\(\quad\)\(\quad\)or, v = 2u

\(\quad\)f = \( \cfrac{uv}{u + v} = \cfrac{2u^{2}}{3u} \) = \( \cfrac{2}{3} \)u

\(\quad\)\(2^{nd}\) case

\(\quad\)m = \( \cfrac{2u + 20}{u - x} \)

\(\quad\)or, 3(u - x) = 2u + 20

\(\quad\)or, 3u - 3x = 2u + 20

\(\quad\)or, 3x = u - 20

\(\quad\)or, x = \( \cfrac{u - 20}{3} \)

\(\quad\)\(\therefore \) u' = u -\( \cfrac{u - 20}{3} = \cfrac{2u + 20}{3} \)

\(\quad\)f \(\) =\( \cfrac{uv}{u + v} = \cfrac{\left(2u + 20\right) \left(2u + 20\right)}{3\left(\cfrac{2u + 20}{3} + 2u + 20\right)} \)

\(\quad\) = \( \cfrac{\left(2u + 20\right)^{2}}{4\left(2u + 20\right)} = \cfrac{2u + 20}{4} = \cfrac{u + 10}{2} \)

\(\quad\)Now, \( \cfrac{2}{3} u = \cfrac{u + 10}{2} \)

\(\quad\)or, 4u = 3u + 30

\(\quad\)u = 30cm\(\quad\)\(\therefore \) x = \( \cfrac{30 - 20}{3} = \cfrac{10}{3} \)cm

quest_title: A hollow metallic sphere of radius R is given a charge Q. Then the potential at the centre is
explanation_txt:
Potential V any where inside the hollow sphere (including the centre) is given by the equation

\(V = \cfrac { 1 } { 4 \pi \varepsilon _ { 0 } } \cfrac { Q } { R }\)

The potential is same inside the hollow cavity and thereby, moving a charge within the hollow cavity takes no work.

quest_title: The production of e.m.f. by maintaining a difference of temperature between the two junctions of two different metals is known as
explanation_txt:
1. Seebeck effect - The phenomenon in which a temperature difference at junctions of two dissimilar electrical conductors produces a voltage difference between the two substances.
  2. Peltier effect - The phenomenon of heat generation and reception at electrified junctions of two different conductors. Peltier effect is the opposite of Seeback effect.
  3. Thomson effect - The phenomenon of evolution or absorption of heat when electric current passes through a circuit composed of a single material that has a temperature difference along its length.
  4. Joule effect - The phenomenon of evolution of heat when electric current is passed on a material having resistance.
question_plain_title: The production of e.m.f. by maintaining a difference of temperature between the two junctions of two different metals is known as
explanation_plain_text:
1. Seebeck effect - The phenomenon in which a temperature difference at junctions of two dissimilar electrical conductors produces a voltage difference between the two substances.
  2. Peltier effect - The phenomenon of heat generation and reception at electrified junctions of two different conductors. Peltier effect is the opposite of Seeback effect.
  3. Thomson effect - The phenomenon of evolution or absorption of heat when electric current passes through a circuit composed of a single material that has a temperature difference along its length.
  4. Joule effect - The phenomenon of evolution of heat when electric current is passed on a material having resistance.
